item.title: Configuration
item.description: Kafka uses the property file format for configuration. These can be supplied either from a file or programmatically. Some configurations have both a default global setting as well as a topic-level overrides. The topic level properties have the format of csv (e.g., “xyz.per.topic=topic1:value1,topic2:value2”) and they override the default value for the specified topics. Broker Configs The essential configurations are the following: broker.id log.dirs zookeeper.connect Property Default Description broker.id Each broker is uniquely identified by a non-negative integer id.
